summary: This document is a collection of administrative records from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, primarily from July and August 2019. It includes watch call logs, special housing unit records for Jeffrey Epstein, body alarm testing assignments, inmate count sheets, and 30-minute check sheets for the Special Housing Unit. The records detail routine prison operations and monitoring procedures during Epstein's incarceration. This document consists of 30-minute inmate observation check sheets from the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, dated July 22-23, 2019. It details the mandated irregular observation schedule for inmates in locked-down status, with staff signatures for each check. The document is significant as it pertains to the period of Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration prior to his death. This document consists of multiple 30-minute inmate check sheets from the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, dated July 23-24, 2019. The sheets record staff observations of inmates in administrative detention or disciplinary segregation, following a protocol requiring checks at least twice per hour. The document is significant as it represents the type of institutional monitoring in place during Jeffrey Epstein's detention prior to his death. This document consists of multiple pages of 30-minute inmate check sheets from the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, dated July 24-25, 2019. It records staff observations of inmates in locked-down status, with signatures for each check. The document is significant as it pertains to the period of Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration prior to his death. This document consists of multiple pages of 30-minute check sheets from the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, dated July 25, 2019. The sheets record staff observations of inmates in continuous lockdown status, with signatures for each time slot. The document is significant as it provides a detailed log of inmate monitoring procedures at the facility where Jeffrey Epstein was held prior to his death. This document consists of multiple pages of 30-minute inmate observation check sheets from the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, dated July 26, 2019. It details the required irregular observation schedule for inmates in locked-down status, with staff signatures for each time slot. The document is significant as it represents the standard operating procedure for inmate monitoring at the facility where Jeffrey Epstein was held prior to his death. This document consists of multiple pages of 30-minute check sheets from the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, dated July 28-29, 2019. It records staff observations of inmates in continuous lockdown status, following a protocol requiring checks at least twice per hour. The sheets are reviewed by lieutenants and a captain. This document consists of 30-minute check sheets from the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, dated July 29-30, 2019. The sheets record staff observations of inmates in locked-down status, following a protocol requiring checks at least twice per hour. The document is significant as it pertains to the period when Jeffrey Epstein was incarcerated at MCC New York.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, New York
MCC New York Special Housing Unit
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was held in the Special Housing Unit at MCC New York in cell 305-124LAD under Unit Manager Aeon Reid.
Epstein's Special Housing Unit records from July 11-20, 2019, show routine entries for meals, showers, and health checks with repeated notes stating 'Voices no medical complaint'.
The documents include detailed 30-minute check sheets for the Special Housing Unit dated July 22, 2019, outlining strict observation protocols for inmates in locked down status.
Prison administrative records such as watch call logs, body alarm testing assignments, and official count sheets illustrate the standard operating procedures at MCC during this period.
An inmate roster from August 10, 2019, lists several inmates with 'SUICIDE' related assignment categories (e.g., 'SUICIDE OR', 'UNASSG SUICIDE OR'), indicating monitoring protocols.
The document is a set of prison logs from the MCC New York Special Housing Unit (SHU) dated July 22-23, 2019.
It outlines the strict protocol requiring staff to observe inmates in locked-down status at least twice per hour on an irregular schedule.
The logs contain numerous staff signatures for each 30-minute observation period, indicating routine monitoring was being documented.
The dates covered are immediately prior to Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody on August 10, 2019, making these logs potentially relevant to investigations into the circumstances of his death.
No specific inmate names are listed in this excerpt; the logs are administrative forms tracking observation rounds.
The document is a series of prison log sheets from the MCC New York Special Housing Unit (SHU) dated July 23-24, 2019.

The logs detail a strict protocol: inmates in continuous locked-down status (administrative detention or disciplinary segregation) must be observed at least twice per hour, on an irregular schedule no more than 40 minutes apart.
Each sheet is reviewed and signed by a Morning Watch Lieutenant and a Captain, indicating a chain of oversight for inmate monitoring.
The document type and dates place it within the timeframe of Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration at the MCC prior to his death in August 2019.
No specific inmate names are listed on these check sheets; they contain only time slots and staff signatures/initials.
The document is a prison log showing 30-minute check sheets for inmates in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at MCC New York.
The logs cover the dates July 24, 2019, and July 25, 2019, which is the period immediately preceding Jeffrey Epstein's death on August 10, 2019.
The checks were required to be conducted on an irregular schedule, with inmates observed at least twice per hour and no more than 40 minutes apart.
The sheets include signatures for each time frame, indicating staff performed the checks, though no staff names are legibly provided in the text.
The document is part of the evidence set (SDNY_00013529 to SDNY_00013536) related to Epstein's incarceration and the conditions of his confinement.
The document is a set of prison log sheets from the MCC New York Special Housing Unit dated July 25, 2019.
It details a strict protocol requiring staff to observe inmates in continuous lockdown at least twice per hour on an irregular schedule.
The sheets contain numerous staff signatures for each 30-minute observation period across multiple tiers (C, H, J, K, L, M, ZB).
The document is part of the official record-keeping for inmate supervision in a high-security unit.
The date (July 25, 2019) is significant as it falls within the period Jeffrey Epstein was incarcerated at MCC New York prior to his death on August 10, 2019.
The document is a set of prison logs from the MCC New York Special Housing Unit (SHU) dated July 26, 2019.
It outlines the strict protocol requiring staff to observe inmates in locked-down status at least twice per hour on an irregular schedule, with no more than 40 minutes between observations.
Each page corresponds to a different housing tier (e.g., ZA TIER-H, ZA TIER-G, L-TIER, M-TIER, ZA TIER-J, ZA TIER-K, ZB) within the SHU.
The logs contain columns for time frames, start/end times, and staff signatures, indicating the checks were performed and documented.
The document is procedural and does not mention any specific inmates by name, including Jeffrey Epstein.
The document is a prison log showing 30-minute observational checks for inmates in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at MCC New York.
The checks were conducted on July 28 and 29, 2019, covering multiple tiers (L-Tier, ZA Tier-J, K, H, G).
The protocol required staff to observe each inmate at least twice per hour, on an irregular schedule no more than 40 minutes apart.
The logs were reviewed by shift lieutenants (Morning, Day, Evening Watch) and a Captain.
The document is a set of prison logs from the MCC New York Special Housing Unit (SHU) dated July 29-30, 2019.
The logs detail a strict observation protocol requiring staff to check on inmates in locked-down status at least twice per hour on an irregular schedule.
The logs cover multiple tiers (L, M, J, K, ZB, G) within the SHU, indicating a standard procedure for high-security or administrative detention.
The dates correspond to the period when Jeffrey Epstein was held at MCC New York prior to his death in August 2019.
The document is part of the official record-keeping for inmate supervision in federal detention.
